alert.note: Alert for Coastal Georgetown; Inland Georgetown; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 7:58PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Georgetown, south central Marion and central Williamsburg Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 758 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Outland to 6 miles northwest of Jamestown. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Murrells Inlet, Andrews, Hemingway, Rhems, Trio, Warsaw, Oatland, Nesmith, Lambert, Sampit, Plantersville, Outland, Graves, Yauhannah, Earle, Morrisville, Henry and Waccamaw Community Hospital. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
